common.definition:
Temporal Logical Rules:
 Temporal Logical Rules "{head}(X0,Xl,Tl)<-R1(X0,X1,T0)&...&Rl(X(l-1),Xl,T(l-1))" are rules used in temporal knowledge graph reasoning to predict relations between entities over time. They describe how the relation "{head}" between entities "X0" and "Xl" evolves from past time steps "Ti (i={{0,...,(l-1)}})"(rule body) to the next "Tl" (rule head), strictly following the constraint "T0 <= ··· <= T(l-1) < Tl".
common.context:
You are an expert in temporal knowledge graph reasoning, and please generate as many temporal logical rules as possible related to "Rl" based on extracted temporal rules.

Here are a few examples: 

Rule head: inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,Xl,Tl)
Sampled rules:
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X1,T1)<-inv_Engage_in_diplomatic_cooperation(X0,X1,T0)
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X3,T3)<-inv_Criticize_or_denounce(X0,X1,T0)&inv_Demand(X1,X2,T1)&Make_a_visit(X2,X3,T2)
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X2,T2)<-Make_a_visit(X0,X1,T0)&Make_a_visit(X1,X2,T1)
Generated Temporal logic rules:
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X1,T1)<-inv_Provide_aid(X0,X1,T0)
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X2,T2)<-Make_an_appeal_or_request(X0,X1,T0)&inv_Consult(X1,X2,T1)
	inv_Provide_humanitarian_aid(X0,X3,T3)<-inv_Return,_release_person(s)(X0,X1,T0)&Return,_release_person(s)(X1,X2,T1)&Accuse(X2,X3,T2)

Rule head: Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,Xl,Tl)
Sampled rules:
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X1,T1)<-inv_Engage_in_symbolic_act(X0,X1,T0)
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X2,T2)<-inv_Criticize_or_denounce(X0,X1,T0)&Make_pessimistic_comment(X1,X2,T1)
Generated Temporal logic rules:
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X1,T1)<-Make_an_appeal_or_request(X0,X1,T0)
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X2,T2)<-inv_Rally_support_on_behalf_of(X0,X1,T0)&Praise_or_endorse(X1,X2,T1)
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X3,T3)<-Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X1,T0)&Host_a_visit(X1,X2,T1)&inv_Criticize_or_denounce(X2,X3,T2)
	Appeal_for_change_in_institutions,_regime(X0,X2,T2)<-inv_Engage_in_symbolic_act(X0,X1,T0)&inv_Consult(X1,X2,T1)

Rule head: Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,Xl,Tl)
Sampled rules:
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X1,T1)<-inv_Reduce_or_stop_military_assistance(X0,X1,T0)
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X2,T2)<-inv_Make_an_appeal_or_request(X0,X1,T0)&Make_statement(X1,X2,T1)
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X3,T3)<-inv_Demand(X0,X1,T0)&inv_Accede_to_demands_for_change_in_leadership(X1,X2,T1)&Accuse(X2,X3,T2)
Generated Temporal logic rules:
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X2,T2)<-Make_an_appeal_or_request(X0,X1,T0)&Appeal_for_military_aid(X1,X2,T1)
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X2,T2)<-inv_Express_intent_to_cooperate(X0,X1,T0)&Make_statement(X1,X2,T1)
	Appeal_for_economic_aid(X0,X1,T1)<-Make_an_appeal_or_request(X0,X1,T0)
common.predict: Let's think step-by-step, please generate as many as possible most relevant temporal rules that are relative to "{head}(X0,Xl,Tl)" based on the above sampled rules.
common.return:
For the relations in rule body, you are going to choose from the following candidates: {candidate_rels}.

 Return the rules only without any explanations.
